1.verse_text: Jerusalem once was full of people. But now the city is empty. Jerusalem once was a great city among the nations. She was like a queen of all the other cities. But now she is a slave. Tears are on her cheeks. There is no one to comfort her. All her lovers are gone. All her friends have turned against her. They have become her enemies. She has suffered and worked hard. She lives among other nations. But she has found no rest. Those who chased her caught her. They caught her when she was in trouble. No one comes to Jerusalem for the feasts. No one passes through her gates. And her priests groan. Her young women are suffering. And Jerusalem suffers terribly. Her enemies enjoy the wealth they have won. The Lord is punishing her for her many sins. Her children have gone away. They are captives of the enemy in a foreign land. has gone away. Her rulers are like deer that cannot find food. They are weak and have run away from those who chased them. She remembers all the precious things she had in the past. She remembers when her people were defeated by the enemy. There was no one to help her. When her enemies saw her, they laughed to see her ruined. So she has become unclean. Those who honored her hate her now because they have seen her nakedness. Jerusalem groans and turns away. She did not think about what would happen to her. Her defeat was surprising. There was no one to comfort her. She says, 'Lord, see how I suffer. He poured out his anger like fire on the tents of Jerusalem. He has swallowed up Israel. He has swallowed up all her palaces. He has destroyed all her strong places. He has caused more moaning and groaning for Judah. He has destroyed the place where he met with his people. The Lord has made Jerusalem forget the set feasts and Sabbath days. 5.verse_text: Remember, Lord, what happened to us. Look and see our disgrace. Our houses have been given to foreigners. Our mothers have become like widows. We must pay for the wood for our fires. We get tired and have no rest. and with Assyria to get enough food. Now we must suffer because of their sins. Because of these things our eyes are dim. Now wild dogs wander around it. You will be King from now on. Why have you left us for so long? Make our days as they were before. Will your anger never end?
